at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server

Class ConnectionAcceptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.ConnectionAcceptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CarConnectionAcceptor, PhoneConnectionAcceptor

    public abstract class ConnectionAcceptor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A ConnectionAcceptor listens to new incoming TCP-connections on the specified port until a new connection is available. It then sets up the connections Socket and creates a new Connection (or subclass thereof) with it, which is then put onto the operationQueue to inform the main thread.
    Author:
    Boeck

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.net.ServerSocket acceptor
      The ServerSocket that is used to listen for new incoming Connections.
      private boolean keepRunning
      The flag, that indicates, if this runnable should continue to be executed or not.
      private static org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger
      The logger that is used for logging messages.
      private java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<QueueElement> operationQueue
      The operationQueue can be written to, to inform the main-thread about certain events and send information-relevant data.
      private int port
      The port that the ServerSocket tries to listen on, for new incoming Connections.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private int bindAcceptor()
      Tries to bind the ServerSocket on the given port.
      void finishAcceptor()
      Sets the keepRunning-flag to false, so that the ServerSocket will be closed and the runnable will finish.
      protected java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<QueueElement> getOperationQueue() 
      int getPort() 
      protected boolean isKeepRunning() 
      protected void setupAcceptor()
      Tries to bind the acceptor on a port.
      protected java.net.Socket setupSocket()
      Blocks until the acceptor accepts a new Socket, sets up the Socket and return it.
      After being accepted, the Sockets so_timeout is set to 1 ms, nagles algorithm is deactivated (prevent data-collection), maximum allowed shutdown time is set to 1 second and the DSCP-byte is set to prioritize the Sockets data-packets over others.
      protected boolean writeToOperationQueue(EOperationType operationType, Connection connection)
      Creates a new QueueElement with the passed operation-type and Connection and puts it on the operationQueue.

        run

    • Field Detail

      • acceptor

        private java.net.ServerSocket acceptor
        The ServerSocket that is used to listen for new incoming Connections.

      • port

        private int port
        The port that the ServerSocket tries to listen on, for new incoming Connections.

      • keepRunning

        private boolean keepRunning
        The flag, that indicates, if this runnable should continue to be executed or not.

      • operationQueue

        private java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<QueueElement> operationQueue
        The operationQueue can be written to, to inform the main-thread about certain events and send information-relevant data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionAcceptor

        public ConnectionAcceptor(int port,
                          java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<QueueElement> operationQueue)
        Parameters:
        port - the port, that the ServerSocket should try to listen on.
        operationQueue - the LinkedBlockingQueue that is used to inform the main-thread about new incoming connections.

    • Method Detail

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns:
        the port that the ServerSocket tries to listen on, for new incoming Connections.

      • getOperationQueue

        protected java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<QueueElement> getOperationQueue()
        Returns:
        the operationQueue can be written to, to inform the main-thread about certain events and send information-relevant data.

      • isKeepRunning

        protected boolean isKeepRunning()
        Returns:
        true, if this runnable should continue to be executed, othwise false.

      • finishAcceptor

        public void finishAcceptor()
        Sets the keepRunning-flag to false, so that the ServerSocket will be closed and the runnable will finish.

      • bindAcceptor

        private int bindAcceptor()
        Tries to bind the ServerSocket on the given port. If it fails to do that 3 times, it tries binding on the next two port 3 times. If binding on all 3 ports fails, zero is returned to indicate an error.
        Returns:
        the actual port, that the ServerSocket was able to be bound to, or 0 if an error occured.

      • setupAcceptor

        protected void setupAcceptor()
        Tries to bind the acceptor on a port. Informs the main-thread, if it is unable to do so and sets keepRunning to false.

      • setupSocket

        protected java.net.Socket setupSocket()
        Blocks until the acceptor accepts a new Socket, sets up the Socket and return it.
        After being accepted, the Sockets so_timeout is set to 1 ms, nagles algorithm is deactivated (prevent data-collection), maximum allowed shutdown time is set to 1 second and the DSCP-byte is set to prioritize the Sockets data-packets over others.
        Returns:
        the fully set up Socket.

      • writeToOperationQueue

        protected boolean writeToOperationQueue(EOperationType operationType,
                                        Connection connection)
        Creates a new QueueElement with the passed operation-type and Connection and puts it on the operationQueue.
        Parameters:
        operationType - the operationType for the new QueueElement
        connection - the Connection fore the new QueueElement
        Returns:
        true, if the new QueueElement has been put on the operationQueue, otherwise false.
